headline: H2O America Announces Appointment of Nick O. Rowe to Board of Directors
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., Feb. 26, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- H2O America (NASDAQ: HTO) announces the appointment of Nick O. Rowe to the H2O America board of directors effective, Mar. 1. Rowe has been a leader in the drinking water industry for 39 years. Prior to his retirement in 2022, he was the senior vice president of American Water Works Company (American Water) and president of its subsidiary, Kentucky American Water Company. headline: Stay Informed: Never Miss a Notification from American Water
summary: American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S., urges customers to update their contact information through its online customer portal, MyWater, in order to receive notifications about emergency alerts as well as non-urgent work taking place in their communities, including water main replacements, flushing or other planned maintenance.

headline: Pennsylvania American Water Announces Launch of American Water Charitable Foundation 2026 Water and Environment Grant Program
summary: Pennsylvania American Water is pleased to announce the launch of the American Water Charitable Foundation's 2026 Water and Environment Grant Program. The Foundation invites community partners to apply for grants that promote clean water, conservation, environmental education, climate variability and water-based recreation projects.

headline: Essential Utilities Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Rise Y/Y
summary: WTRG tops Q4 EPS and revenue estimates as higher water and gas rates lift sales, while the merger with American Water Works progresses toward a 2027 close.

raw.headline: Essential Utilities Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Rise Y/Y
raw.summary: WTRG tops Q4 EPS and revenue estimates as higher water and gas rates lift sales, while the merger with American Water Works progresses toward a 2027 close.

headline: Kentucky American Water to Upgrade Water Infrastructure on Leawood Drive with $630,000 Investment
summary: Kentucky American Water is investing approximately $630,000 to upgrade critical water infrastructure on Leawood Dr. in Lexington, replacing approximately a half mile of aging water main to help ensure continued reliability, water quality and fire protection for customers. The project will replace a 6-inch water main installed in the 1960s with a new 8‑inch ductile iron main.

headline: California Water Service Group Q4 Earnings & Revenues Miss Estimates
summary: CWT Q4 earnings miss estimates as revenues slip and expenses rise, even as the company boosts dividends and ramps up infrastructure spending.
